title: Keir Starmer suffers major Labour rebellion over Gaza ceasefire vote
description: Sir Keir Starmer has suffered a major rebellion over his stance on the Israel-Gaza war, with 56 of his MPs voting for an immediate ceasefire. Jess Phillips, Afzal Khan and Yasmin Qureshi were among shadow ministers who quit their roles to back the motion from the SNP.

title: Labour rebels who defied Keir Starmer to vote for a ceasefire in Gaza could return to his top team
description: It has been suggested the eight shadow ministers and two parliamentary private secretaries who stood down on Wednesday night after ignoring a three-line whip could still be part of a future government

title: Sir Keir Starmer begs Labour to be ‘as united as we can’ after eight frontbenchers quit over Gaza ceasefire vote
description: SIR Keir Starmer wants Labour to be “as united as we can” after eight frontbenchers quit over the Gaza ceasefire vote. And it emerged axed rebels including Jess Phillips could still get a top job

title: Why does Sir Keir Starmer not support a ceasefire in Gaza?
description: Sir Keir Starmer's leadership has been tested after more than 50 of his MPs and eight shadow ministers rebelled over Labour's refusal to back a ceasefire in Gaza. In total, 56 Labour MPs defied Sir Keir's orders and voted in favour of an SNP amendment that called explicitly for a ceasefire in Gaza - despite warnings that it was designed to cause "division".

title: IAN AUSTIN: If Keir Starmer doesn't get tougher, he'll lose control of his party
description: Keir Starmer hasn't faced a challenge like it since he took control of Labour three years ago, after ten members of his frontbench team either quit or have been sacked

title: Keir Starmer bruised in fight with Labour party he did not want
description: Critics say Labour leader missed chance to sound more sympathetic to Palestinian suffering and accept that a Gaza ceasefire call was implied

title: Gaza revolt embarrassing for Keir Starmer but are there positives?
description: Clearly, the Labour rebellion over a ceasefire in Gaza was embarrassing for Sir Keir Starmer. It's the biggest parliamentary revolt he's suffered in his three and a half years as Labour leader, which is especially unusual because over that time he has generally tightened his grip over the party.

title: Keir Starmer's whisky gaffe 'could cost him election in Scotland'
description: KEIR Starmer has thrown the next election – at least in Scotland – with an absolute howler of a tweet about our national drink.

title: Keir Starmer has misread the room on Gaza ceasefire vote
description: Letters: The leader of the opposition has got ahead of himself, writes Hannah Walker, while Chris Sinha accuses him of failing to prioritise principles over electoral strategy. Plus letters from Derri

title: Sir Keir Starmer 'right to be firm' on ceasefire rebels - shadow minister
description: The shadow defence secretary has defended his leader's decision to not back calls for a ceasefire in the Middle East.

title: Keir Starmer Insists Labour Is 'United' Over Israel-Hamas War Despite Massive Rebellion
description: Labour leader Keir Starmer during a visit to the InchDairnie Distillery in Glenrothes, Fife. Keir Starmer has insisted Labour is “united” over the Israel-Hamas war - despite a massive rebellion by his MPs last night. Dozens of backbenchers, plus eight shadow ministers, defied their leader to back SNP calls for a ceasefire in the conflict.

title: Keir Starmer calls for 'united' Labour Party after rebellion on Gaza vote
description: The Labour leader saw ten of his MPs quit the party on Wednesday, following a Commons vote on the Israel-Gaza crisis. | ITV National News

title: Sir Keir left reeling after rebellion over Gaza vote
description: SIR KEIR STARMER was reeling today after facing the biggest rebellion of his leadership over his backing for Israel’s continuing war on Gaza. Ten frontbenchers were among 56 Labour MPs backing a Commons amendment urging an immediate ceasefire, nearly a third of the Parliamentary Labour Party.

title: Keir Starmer ‘open to returning Elgin Marbles’
description: Sir Keir Starmer is “favourable” to returning the Elgin Marbles but will not raise the issue until after the general election, Greek media has claimed.Privately

title: Keir Starmer wants Labour 'as united as we can' after suffering major Gaza vote rebellion
description: Labour leader Keir Starmer said managing his party is 'secondary to the international situation' as he considers replacements for eight shadow ministers who quit over the Gaza vote

title: Keir Starmer’s hardline stance on Gaza is asking for trouble
description: The rebellion over the Israeli ceasefire call is no threat to the leader, but his handling of it could be, writes John Rentoul

title: Labour insist rebellion was no bigger than expected - but loss of Jess Phillips is a big blow for Keir Starmer
description: Most of the MPs who rebelled against Sir Keir Starmer were minor figures holding low-key posts - but Jess Phillips, the high-profile shadow Home Office minister, was one notable exception.

title: Tory MP calls out Keir Starmer’s ‘lack of manners’ after he ‘fails to say thank you'
description: Conservative MP for East Devon Simon Jupp called out Sir Keir Starmer claiming he does not say thanks when he has a door opened for him.

title: Keir Starmer could welcome back Labour rebels sacked over ceasefire vote
description: Labour frontbenchers who defied Sir Keir Starmer and backed a ceasefire in Gaza could return to his top team if he wins the next election, the shadow defence se

title: How your MP voted in Gaza ceasfire vote as Labour revolt against Keir Starmer - full list
description: The ceasefire vote also saw the biggest Labour rebellion of Sir Keir Starmer's leadership when 56MPs defied the party whip to vote for the ceasefire.

title: Labour downplays Gaza vote as 15 London MPs join revolt against Keir Starmer
description: The Labour party on Thursday played down its divisions over Gaza after 15 London MPs joined a significant rebellion against Sir Keir Starmer and backed a ceasefire in Israel’s war against Hamas.

title: Sir Keir Starmer hits out at 'unforgivable' failure over Scotch whisky industry during Scotland visit
description: The visit for a Fife whisky distillery by Sir Keir Starmer has come less than 24 hours after he suffered from a rebellion within Labour ranks at Westminster

title: Jess Phillips among eight MPs in Keir Starmer's frontbench to defy whip and vote for Gaza ceasefire amendment
description: Sir Keir Starmer faced with a huge rebellion from his parliamentary party on Wednesday evening after 56 MPs defied a three-line whip to back an SNP amendment calling for a ceasefire in Gaza. Eight frontbenchers, including Jess Phillips, quit the frontbench in order to back the amendment, which was rejected 293 to 125, with a majority of 168.

title: Keir Starmer loses eight frontbenchers in major rebellion over Gaza ceasefire
description: Eight frontbenchers quit the Labour Party last night, in a major blow to Labour leader Keir Starmer over the party’s stance on a ceasefire in Gaza. The major rebellion occurred as more than a quarter of Labour’s MPs defied Starmer to support an ...

title: Setbacks for both Rishi Sunak and Keir Starmer may store up trouble
description: Rebellion over Gaza stance posed no threat to Labour leader’s position but could presage more internal wrangling

title: Labour leader Sir Keir Starmer looking for party unity after major Gaza rebellion
description: Watch the latest from ITV News -

title: Northern Ireland loyalists, Germans and Sir Keir Starmer... now THAT’s a highly unusual alliance
description: It’s comforting having no ‘skin in the game’. It was the best way to navigate through four decades of the Troubles. But this is Northern Ireland, so folk think there must be bias.

title: Keir Starmer challenges Sunak over David Cameron China links
description: Sir Keir Starmer has challenged Rishi Sunak over his appointment of David Cameron as foreign secretary, raising concerns about his links to China. The Labour leader asked when there would be "full public disclosure for his work for Chinese interests".

title: CADFA’s call to Sir Keir Starmer on the war
description: Sir Keir Starmer is our MP and we have had taken part in many demonstrations in Camden in the past few weeks calling on him to back the call for a ceasefire and also seeking to talk to people about the issue.

title: Labour MP Jess Phillips joins wave of MPs quitting frontbench over Sir Keir Starmer’s stance on Gaza
description: Labour MP Jess Phillips has quit the frontbench after deciding to support an SNP amendment to the King’s Speech backing a ceasefire. Sir Keir Starmer has lost a total of eight frontbenchers after he suffered a major rebellion in a Commons vote calling for a ceasefire in Gaza.

title: Labour’s Gaza revolt is less damaging for Keir Starmer than it appears
description: The damage to the government following the Supreme Court’s ruling on the Rwanda plan is serious. The Supreme Court’s ruling that the Rwanda scheme is unlawful punctures the government’s hopes to deport refugees before the next election. But it will press on with the policy.

title: Keir Starmer insists Labour 'united' after Gaza ceasefire rebellion
description: KEIR Starmer has insisted Labour is united on the Israel-Hamas war – despite a massive rebellion from his MPs on the issue and a wave

title: Dozens of Labour MPs break rank to defy Keir Starmer over vote for ceasefire in Gaza
description: Last night, MPs voted on amendments to the King’s Speech as dozens of Labour rebels backed an SNP motion calling for a ceasefire in Gaza. In total, eight Labour frontbenchers including Jess Phillips resigned from the Labour frontbench in order to do so ...

title: ‘It’s time Keir Starmer showed some humanity’
description: Fellow NEC member Jess Barnard backed the call, saying “it’s time Keir Starmer showed some humanity.” And in an appeal in Tribune magazine, former Scottish Labour leader Richard Leonard urged Labour MPs to “put themselves on the right side of history and vote for a ceasefire in Gaza.”

title: 'Where is Keir Starmer's conscious?'
description: For the 56 Labour MPs who defied the whip, "the moral obscenity was too great, as was the potential political cost". For Keir Starmer, this "moment of moral outrage" will "not be forgotten". He will surely win the next election, but "this saga ensures ...

title: Rishi Sunak and Keir Starmer go round in circles at PMQs
description: After the Supreme Court’s unfavourable ruling on the Government’s Rwanda plan for migrants, Rishi Sunak, the man who puts the PM into

title: Humza Yousaf accuses Keir Starmer of ‘lack of moral leadership’ as SNP pushes for Gaza ceasefire vote
description: Humza Yousaf has accused Labour of a “complete lack of moral leadership” following reports that Keir Starmer will sack any frontbench MP who votes on the SNP’s amendment on a ceasefire in Gaza. The SNP has put forward an amendment to Wednesday’s ...

title: Dozens of Labour MPs break rank to defy Keir Starmer over vote for ceasefire in Gaza
description: Last night, MPs voted on amendments to the King’s Speech as dozens of Labour rebels backed an SNP motion calling for a ceasefire in Gaza. In total, eight Labour frontbenchers including Jess Phillips resigned from the Labour frontbench in order to do so ...

title: Sir Keir Stamer considers putting Labour Israel-Hamas motion to Commons amid worries over party unity
description: Sir Keir Starmer is considering putting a motion to parliament on Wednesday over Labour's position on the Israel-Hamas war.

title: Labour accuses SNP of 'political ploy' as rebels defy Keir Starmer in Gaza ceasefire vote
description: It was reported that frontbench rebels would be sacked if they did so, with a spokesperson for leader Keir Starmer saying that "this is a whipped vote and every MP knows what the consequence of that means". But almost 70 Labour MPs defied the party line to ...

title: Israel-Hamas ceasefire: Anas Sarwar faces pressure to rebel against Keir Starmer on Gaza as SNP force Holyrood vote
description: Scottish Labour leader Anas Sarwar also faces internal opposition to the UK leader’s position, with eight MSPs backing a pro-ceasefire motion

title: UK: Labour leader Sir Keir Starmer suffers large rebellion over Gaza ceasefire motion
description: Opposition Labour Party leader Sir Keir Starmer has suffered a rebellion by 56 MPs, including eight shadow cabinet members voting for a parliamentary motion put by the Scottish National Party (SNP) for a ceasefire in Gaza. Starmer has refused to call for a ceasefire since the moment that Israel starting bombing Gaza on October 8.

title: Labour rebels defy Keir Starmer to back SNP call for Gaza ceasefire
description: Shadow Scotland Secretary Ian Murray and new Rutherglen MP Michael Shanks voted in favour of the Labour amendment and abstained on the SNP one.

title: Keir Starmer set to face biggest rebellion of leadership
description: Sir Keir Starmer looks set to face the biggest rebellion of his leadership, with dozens of his MPs set to defy the leadership and back an SNP

title: Sir Keir Starmer to submit Labour Israel-Hamas amendment to Commons amid worries over party unity
description: Labour will put forward an amendment to parliament on Wednesday that will give MPs a vote on the Israel-Hamas war, the party has said.

title: Express & Star readers put Labour leader Sir Keir Starmer on the spot in Q&A session
description: Labour leader Sir Keir Starmer faced a grilling from Express & Star readers during a visit to its offices. Sir Keir faced a series of searching questions about pensions, the state of the high street, health and education during a visit to the newspaper's head office in Wolverhampton.

title: Preston mosques demand local Labour group calls for Keir Starmer resignation
description: Masjid E Noor Mosque Every mosque in Preston has issued a “demand” for Labour councillors in the city to call on Sir Keir Starmer to resign over his sta

title: Can Keir Starmer prevent mass resignations over Gaza?
description: One MP described David Cameron’s return as a “slap in the face”, but the Tory party has little appetite for further infighting.

title: Labour frontbenchers defy Keir Starmer to back SNP Gaza amendment
description: Multiple Labour frontbenchers have defied Keir Starmer with a pledge to back calls for a ceasefire in Gaza in a crunch Commons vote.

title: UK: Jaishankar meets UK's Leader of Opposition Keir Starmer, affirms commitment to boosting bilateral ties
description: On Tuesday, Jaishankar met with his British counterpart David Cameron and discussed progressing a Free Trade Agreement and partnerships on defence, science and technology. During the meeting, the two leaders reflected on the strength of the UK-India relationship, including meeting the ambitions of the UK-India 2030 Roadmap.

title: Eight Labour councillors in Hackney urge party leader Sir Keir Starmer to back all-out ceasefire in Gaza
description: Frank Baffour, Fliss Premru, Sophie Conway, Clare Joseph, Claudia Turbet-Delof, and Penny Wrout are among 300 party colleagues who have signed an open letter urging Sir Keir Starmer to back an all-out ceasefire.

title: Timeline of Rwanda asylum plan leading up to the Supreme Court’s ruling
description: The Supreme Court judgment on the Government’s plans to removal asylum seekers to Rwanda comes more than 18 months after they were first announced. Legal battles have meant no migrants have been sent to the East African nation under the policy, which the UK’s highest court has concluded is unlawful.

title: Labour accuses SNP of 'political ploy' as rebels defy Keir Starmer in Gaza ceasefire vote
description: It was reported that frontbench rebels would be sacked if they did so, with a spokesperson for leader Keir Starmer saying that "this is a whipped vote and every MP knows what the consequence of that means". But almost 70 Labour MPs defied the party line to ...

title: Israel-Hamas ceasefire: Anas Sarwar faces pressure to rebel against Keir Starmer on Gaza as SNP force Holyrood vote
description: Scottish Labour leader Anas Sarwar also faces internal opposition to the UK leader’s position, with eight MSPs backing a pro-ceasefire motion

title: UK: Labour leader Sir Keir Starmer suffers large rebellion over Gaza ceasefire motion
description: Opposition Labour Party leader Sir Keir Starmer has suffered a rebellion by 56 MPs, including eight shadow cabinet members voting for a parliamentary motion put by the Scottish National Party (SNP) for a ceasefire in Gaza. Starmer has refused to call for a ceasefire since the moment that Israel starting bombing Gaza on October 8.

title: Labour rebels defy Keir Starmer to back SNP call for Gaza ceasefire
description: Shadow Scotland Secretary Ian Murray and new Rutherglen MP Michael Shanks voted in favour of the Labour amendment and abstained on the SNP one.

title: Keir Starmer set to face biggest rebellion of leadership
description: Sir Keir Starmer looks set to face the biggest rebellion of his leadership, with dozens of his MPs set to defy the leadership and back an SNP

title: Sir Keir Starmer to submit Labour Israel-Hamas amendment to Commons amid worries over party unity
description: Labour will put forward an amendment to parliament on Wednesday that will give MPs a vote on the Israel-Hamas war, the party has said.

title: Express & Star readers put Labour leader Sir Keir Starmer on the spot in Q&A session
description: Labour leader Sir Keir Starmer faced a grilling from Express & Star readers during a visit to its offices. Sir Keir faced a series of searching questions about pensions, the state of the high street, health and education during a visit to the newspaper's head office in Wolverhampton.

title: Preston mosques demand local Labour group calls for Keir Starmer resignation
description: Masjid E Noor Mosque Every mosque in Preston has issued a “demand” for Labour councillors in the city to call on Sir Keir Starmer to resign over his sta

title: Can Keir Starmer prevent mass resignations over Gaza?
description: One MP described David Cameron’s return as a “slap in the face”, but the Tory party has little appetite for further infighting.

title: Labour frontbenchers defy Keir Starmer to back SNP Gaza amendment
description: Multiple Labour frontbenchers have defied Keir Starmer with a pledge to back calls for a ceasefire in Gaza in a crunch Commons vote.

title: UK: Jaishankar meets UK's Leader of Opposition Keir Starmer, affirms commitment to boosting bilateral ties
description: On Tuesday, Jaishankar met with his British counterpart David Cameron and discussed progressing a Free Trade Agreement and partnerships on defence, science and technology. During the meeting, the two leaders reflected on the strength of the UK-India relationship, including meeting the ambitions of the UK-India 2030 Roadmap.

title: Eight Labour councillors in Hackney urge party leader Sir Keir Starmer to back all-out ceasefire in Gaza
description: Frank Baffour, Fliss Premru, Sophie Conway, Clare Joseph, Claudia Turbet-Delof, and Penny Wrout are among 300 party colleagues who have signed an open letter urging Sir Keir Starmer to back an all-out ceasefire.

title: Timeline of Rwanda asylum plan leading up to the Supreme Court’s ruling
description: The Supreme Court judgment on the Government’s plans to removal asylum seekers to Rwanda comes more than 18 months after they were first announced. Legal battles have meant no migrants have been sent to the East African nation under the policy, which the UK’s highest court has concluded is unlawful.

title: ‘It’s time Keir Starmer showed some humanity’
description: Fellow NEC member Jess Barnard backed the call, saying “it’s time Keir Starmer showed some humanity.” And in an appeal in Tribune magazine, former Scottish Labour leader Richard Leonard urged Labour MPs to “put themselves on the right side of history and vote for a ceasefire in Gaza.”

title: 'Where is Keir Starmer's conscious?'
description: For the 56 Labour MPs who defied the whip, "the moral obscenity was too great, as was the potential political cost". For Keir Starmer, this "moment of moral outrage" will "not be forgotten". He will surely win the next election, but "this saga ensures ...

title: Rishi Sunak and Keir Starmer go round in circles at PMQs
description: After the Supreme Court’s unfavourable ruling on the Government’s Rwanda plan for migrants, Rishi Sunak, the man who puts the PM into

title: Humza Yousaf accuses Keir Starmer of ‘lack of moral leadership’ as SNP pushes for Gaza ceasefire vote
description: Humza Yousaf has accused Labour of a “complete lack of moral leadership” following reports that Keir Starmer will sack any frontbench MP who votes on the SNP’s amendment on a ceasefire in Gaza. The SNP has put forward an amendment to Wednesday’s ...

title: Dozens of Labour MPs break rank to defy Keir Starmer over vote for ceasefire in Gaza
description: Last night, MPs voted on amendments to the King’s Speech as dozens of Labour rebels backed an SNP motion calling for a ceasefire in Gaza. In total, eight Labour frontbenchers including Jess Phillips resigned from the Labour frontbench in order to do so ...
